job_tasks.phrase: Define success metrics for our models
job_tasks.justification: Defining success metrics is a crucial part of the data lifecycle for machine learning models, involving understanding how to measure their performance and impact.

job_tasks.phrase: Create & evaluate forecasting & LLM models to drive those metrics
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly refers to the creation and evaluation of both traditional forecasting models and Large Language Models (LLMs), which falls under model development and fine-tuning.

job_tasks.phrase: Build internal tooling to customise models to new enterprise customers
job_tasks.justification: Building internal tooling to customize models involves software development and integration to make models adaptable for specific customer needs.

job_tasks.phrase: Build infrastructure to monitor performance and act on it
job_tasks.justification: This describes the creation of infrastructure for monitoring model performance and taking action, which is a core aspect of MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: Build the underlying data infrastructure together with our engineering team
job_tasks.justification: Building data infrastructure is a key task in data engineering, essential for supporting ML models.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with engineers, designers and founders (they come from Fintech & Treasury!) to understand better what needs to be built and speak up when we are focusing on the wrong things
job_tasks.justification: This involves collaboration with other teams to define and build software features, aligning with software development and integration responsibilities.

job_tasks.phrase: Explore new technologies that improve all of the above.
job_tasks.justification: Exploring new technologies related to data and models falls under the broader scope of data engineering and management, as it involves improving the data lifecycle and model development processes.

soft_skills.phrase: Collaborate with engineers, designers and founders (they come from Fintech & Treasury!) to understand better what needs to be built and speak up when we are focusing on the wrong things
soft_skills.justification: This phrase explicitly mentions collaboration with different teams and the need to communicate effectively about project direction.

soft_skills.phrase: You'll join as the first Data hire with a broad mandate
soft_skills.justification: Being the first data hire with a broad mandate implies taking ownership and driving initiatives.

soft_skills.phrase: We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there's more to come!
soft_skills.justification: This indicates a need for continuous learning and adaptation to new technologies.

soft_skills.phrase: Explore new technologies that improve all of the above.
soft_skills.justification: Directly states the need to explore and adopt new technologies.

soft_skills.phrase: speak up when we are focusing on the wrong things
soft_skills.justification: This implies critical thinking and a pragmatic approach to ensure the team is focused on the right priorities.

profile.rationale: The job ad clearly outlines a balanced mix of core software engineering tasks (building internal tooling, infrastructure, data infrastructure) and AI specialization tasks. Crucially, it explicitly mentions 'LLM models' alongside 'forecasting models', and the role involves defining metrics, creating/evaluating models, building tooling for customization, monitoring, and exploring new technologies. This blend, with a specific mention of LLMs, points towards a Core GenAI Engineer profile.

confidence.reasoning: The job advertisement is very clear and detailed, explicitly mentioning both traditional ML (forecasting) and GenAI (LLM models) tasks, along with specific responsibilities related to model development, data infrastructure, tooling, and monitoring. The technologies are also clearly listed. This clarity allows for a high-confidence analysis.
